Package cetus.hir

Class MinMaxExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • cetus.hir.Expression
      • cetus.hir.MinMaxExpression
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Printable, Traversable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Expression>
    public class MinMaxExpression
extends Expression
    Class for MIN() MAX() expressions - these are equivalent to conditional expressions.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class cetus.hir.Expression

      • MinMaxExpression

        public MinMaxExpression​(boolean ismin)
        Constructs a min/max expression with the specified operator description.
        Parameters:
        ismin - true for MIN, false for MAX.

      • MinMaxExpression

        public MinMaxExpression​(boolean ismin,
                        Expression lhs,
                        Expression rhs)
        Consructs a min/max expression with the specified operator flag and the two operand expressions.
        Parameters:
        ismin - true if the operator is MIN, false otherwise
        lhs - the first operand
        rhs - the second operand
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if lhs or rhs is invalid.
        NotAnOrphanException - if lhs or rhs has a parent.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode​(int h)
        Description copied from class: Expression
        Returns cumulative hash code with the given initial value, h. This is intended for optimizing memory usage when computing hash code of an expression object. Previous approach constructs a string representation of the expression to get the hash code while this approach uses the same algorithm as String.hashCode() without creating a string. All sub classes of Expression have there specific implementations of this method and Expression.hashCode() simply returns hashCode(0).
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Expression

      • isMin

        public boolean isMin()
        Returns true if this is a MIN expression.
        Returns:
        true if this is a MIN expression, false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
        Description copied from class: Expression
        Checks if the given object is has the same type with this expression and its children is same with this expression's. The sub classes of expression should call this method first and proceed with more checking if they have additional fields to be checked.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Expression
        Parameters:
        o - the object to be compared with.
        Returns:
        true if o!=null, this.getClass()==o.getClass(), and this.children.equals(o.children) || this.children==o.children==null
